newsitem.title: USA: Dart Group offers to buy or sell food unit.
newsitem.headline: Dart Group offers to buy or sell food unit.

text.p: Dart Group Corp. said Monday it has offered to either buy the 50 percent stake in Shoppers Food Warehouse Corp. it does not already own for $210 million in cash, or sell its 50 percent stake for the same price.
Dart made the offer to Kenneth M. Herman who, with family members, owns the other 50 percent of Shoppers Food, a supermarket chain in the Washington area.
Landover, Md.-based Dart said that under an amended shareholders' agreement, Herman must accept one of Dart's offers within 60 days.
For fiscal 1996, Shoppers Food reported sales of $836 million and net income of $18.9 million, Dart said.

Separately, Dart reported a net loss of of $1.16 million, or 66 cents a share, for its fiscal third quarter ended Oct. 31. That compared with a net loss of $15.3 million, or $8.16 per share, for the same period last year.
The year ago loss was mostly due to $14.6 million pre-tax write-down of Dart's Cabot-Morgan Real Estate Co. partnership interest.
